fields.description:
Tested on ag-grid version 16 and our new release 17.

iOS
Version 17 - New feature allows you to drag the column edge to resize. No double tapping to expand
Version 16 - Unable to expand column by double tapping of columns edge

Android
Version 17 - New feature allows you to drag the column edge to resize. No double tapping
Version 16 - Expands column by double tapping of columns edges.

The latest version 17 hasn't got the double click feature anymore for touch devices.
fields.summary: Touch Devices Unable to expand column by double tapping on edges.

fields.description:
Right now we just check for chrome. See github issue. 


Even though this was an on purpose design choice. 

From the docs at 13.3.0...

By default the grid will use the browser provided date picker for Chrome (as we think it's nice), but for all other browser it will just provide a simple text field. You can provide your chosen date picker to ag-Grid. This is done by providing a custom Date Component via the grid property dateComponent as follows:
fields.customfield_10522: browserDatePicker:This is only taking into consideration if there isn’t a date component provided. By default the grid will use the browser date pick in Chrome and a plain text box for all other browsers (this is because Chrome is the only browser providing a decent out of the box date picker). If this property is true, the browser date picker will be used regardless of the browser type. so i explain what happens first, as the property builds on this
fields.summary: Allow forcing type date for the column no matter what browser

fields.description:
Niall note: I got this email from user. Not sure if it's an issue, maybe the solutions is to just sanitise the business key???

Email from user:

I've just been upgrading our app to ag-grid v15 and while investing https://github.com/ag-grid/ag-grid/issues/2133, I believe I've uncovered an XSS issue that would surface if somebody set the business key to user data.

See https://plnkr.co/edit/FSZz93neKGAzqymCk6N5?p=preview for an example.

To be honest, I've not looked closely at the rest of the library so I have no idea if anything else is similarly vulnerable, but the section of code responsible is here: https://github.com/ag-grid/ag-grid/blob/master/src/ts/rendering/rowComp.ts#L190-L202, which string stitches html together without escaping anything (ideally it would use DOM apis instead of building a string here).

I suppose if anything else did similar, then it would also be vulnerable. Again though, I've not looked.

I thought I'd email you directly rather than create an issue on GitHub as it seems, to me at least, like the sort of thing you'd want to fix before being made public.
fields.summary: getBusinessKeyForNode should sanitise input

fields.description:
Came in to Niall over email, it's from CS.

I have just updated ag-grid version in one of our applications, and I have noticed non-backward compatible behaviour of ensureNodeVisible() API method. Previous behaviour was that when node is visible, then grid is not scrolled.

Now I see new parameter position in the API: ensureNodeVisible(comparator, position), but reading documentation, when this parameter is null or undefined, then function should behave this same:
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-grid-api/#gsc.tab=0
“If top, middle or bottom, the grid will scroll the row to place the row at top, middle or bottom. If undefined or null then grid will do the minimum scrolling to show the row”
 
Now from my observations it behaves different and scrolls always. After little investigation I have found this revision:
https://github.com/ag-grid/ag-grid/commit/3c92d76a80804479f84dd2b3929c80192af8c078
public ensureNodeVisible(comparator:any, position:string = 'top')
fields.summary: ensureNodeVisible non-backward compatible behaviour

fields.description:
With Angular CLI 1.5 (the latest) if you run ng build --prod then the following error will be thrown:

ERROR in ./node_modules/ag-grid/dist/lib/gridOptionsWrapper.js
Module build failed: RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded
 
This will be intermittent (say 3 out of 5 builds will fail) but it is reproducible. I believe that this error is down to the cyclic deps we have in core.

A reliable workaround is to have this in package.json:

    "prod": "node --stack_size=8048 node_modules/.bin/ng build --prod",

Which increases the amount of available memory
fields.summary: Angular CLI 1.5 - ng build --prod causes a stack error

fields.description:
Pressing control-enter in an editor clears the cell content and doesn't close the editor.

The control-enter triggers a keypress event after the keydown (which is closing the editor, as expected). CellComp.onKeyPress reads the charCode as 10 (instead of 13 for 'enter'), which is processed as a \n character. This goes to Utils.isEventFromPrintableCharacter which incorrectly classifies the \n as printable. Then, because the user has 'input' a 'printable' character on a cell that's not editing, it starts editing, using \n as the initially typed character.
fields.summary: [edit] Ctrl-Enter resets cell editor to blank

fields.description:
the user on github says that the order of the rows in the dom is not consistent with the order of the rows in the grid, so when you tab into the grid, it's the first row in the dom that gets the focus, not the first row in the grid.

this is how the grid should work, the rows are not necessarily added in the order they appear.

options to fix:
1) when user tabs into the grid, somehow put the focus on the first row - which would be tricky if the user is scrolled down.
2) let the user decide somehow how to handle this. i think this is a can of worms, however if we can document somehow to the user can catch the tab event, and then let them decide which row / cell gets the focus, then this would all go away.


niall thought - have thought about this a lot, and think with row virtualisation (ie the first rendered row will not be row 1, and won't even be the first row on the screen with the rowBuffer), so i am deciding on option 1 above. i see some interesting ideas on the link here:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10731468/override-default-tabbing-navigation
in particular, i think the onus should be on the user to put a listener on the last item they have, and then they do some gridApi calls to maybe 1) scroll grid to first row and then 2) put focus on first cell.

fields.description:
Not easy to reproduce, but click around, sort etc and eventually a hamburger will appear

This is confusing to users as it implies it can be clicked on.

Niall note - I went to look into this - it's tricky, as we don't know when the user is on iPad or a device where we should not be showing the hamburger. We could check for touch, however some devices (eg touch screen windows machines) allow both touch and mouse, so cannot be 'one or the other'. One solution would be to suppress the hamburger in the menu - however I'd like to take a step back and think about how the headers are configured rather than hack a fix in for this (the fix would be a property 'suppressHamburger' which the user would set, and suppress the hamburger but still allow the touch support for showing the menu). . . . . . . or we do nothing and just live with it, fixing it would cause other issues (eg if we got the grid to not show the hamburger, then we would not show it sometimes when the user wants it shown).
fields.summary: [iPad] hamburger occasionally appears but cannot be clicked
